definition: not follow the beaten track/have an original style

sentences.chinese: 不一定不同，但要不落窠臼。

sentences.english: They take the answer back to their cave and add it to the pile of opinions.
sentences.chinese: 他們把這些答案帶回自己的窠臼中堆砌起來。

sentences.english: I quit because I don't want to be stuck in a rut.
sentences.chinese: 我不想陷入窠臼所以才辭職。

sentences.english: Deadpool is the latest film to smash the former superhero mold.
sentences.chinese: 《死侍》是最新一部打破之前超級英雄窠臼的電影。

sentences.english: Challenges break you out of your mold and help develop your character.
sentences.chinese: 挑戰可以帶出走出你的窠臼並幫你開發自己的個性。

sentences.english: Companies as a whole are stuck in the rut of an old mindset.
sentences.chinese: 公司作爲一個整體是滯留在腐朽心態的窠臼裏的。

definition: not follow the beaten track/have an original style
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
to follow old patterns/to imitate existing models/to continue along the same lines
stick-in-the-mud/to stick to old ways/stubbornly conservative
(idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes
stuck in the old ways (idiom); refusing to acknowledge new ideas/stagnating and conservative
to continue the same old routine/to carry on just as before/to procrastinate
to follow in other people's footsteps
